keyword: how many calories are in one pound of ground beef
title: How Many Calories Are in One Pound of Ground Beef?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in one pound of ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, per-100g breakdown, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in One Pound of Ground Beef?
assumptions: 80% lean, 20% fat; cooked (pan-broiled), drained of excess fat; no added seasonings or oils; 1 pound ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat percentage, cooking method, draining, brand, and portion size. Check labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One pound of cooked 80/20 ground beef provides ~1118 kcal and ~109 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp vegetable oil during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories are in one pound of 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: About 1118 kcal for cooked and drained 80/20 ground beef.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in one pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 109 g of protein per pound of cooked 80/20 ground beef.

faqs.q: Does fat percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—leaner cuts like 90/10 have fewer calories (~891 kcal per pound) than 80/20.

faqs.q: Are these values for cooked or raw ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked (pan-broiled and drained); raw has slightly more calories but cooking reduces weight by fat loss.

faqs.q: How much fat is in one pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 73 g total fat, including 28 g saturated, for cooked 80/20 ground beef.
